intro: Dendropemon brachycarpus, commonly known as the short-fruited tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family. It is a tropical plant characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as rainforests. Its rhizome system supports the growth of its tall stem and provides nutrients to the fronds. Dendropemon brachycarpus plays a role in forest ecosystems by offering habitat and contributing to biodiversity.
